name: Teddy S. BIONI v. CANON-McMILLAN SCHOOL DISTRICT, Appellant

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, and STOUT, JJ.
parties: Teddy S. BIONI v. CANON-McMILLAN SCHOOL DISTRICT, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Matter remanded to Commonwealth Court for a determination on the present record of the legal question as to whether the lathe is personalty or realty. Jurisdiction relinquished.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: John C. Pettit and W. Patrie Boyer, Pettit and Associates, Washington, for appellant.
Samuel Y. Stroh and Paul W. Stefano, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
555 A.2d 901
Teddy S. BIONI v. CANON-McMILLAN SCHOOL DISTRICT, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 6, 1989.
Decided April 7, 1989.
John C. Pettit and W. Patrie Boyer, Pettit and Associates, Washington, for appellant.
Samuel Y. Stroh and Paul W. Stefano, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS, and STOUT, JJ.
This decision was considered and rendered prior to March 7, 1989.
